name: understudying
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
present participle of
understudy
to learn the lines of other actors in a play, so that you can replace them if necessary, for example if they are ill: He understudied the title role in Broadway's "Tarzan". Big roles are always given to big stars, so understudying is the only way in the beginning. Compare
stand in
substitute for someone/something
More examplesFewer examplesHe was with the national tour of "The Lion King", understudying the roles of Scar and Pumbaa.She essentially understudies eleven characters in the musical.Lisa Fennell, in addition to her role in the chorus, was to understudy Désirée.
